definition: (idiom) to experience it for oneself/to actually *be* there (as opposed to reading about it etc)
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
border/place/condition/boundary/circumstances/territory

sentences.english: However, to appreciate the beauty of Sanqingshan need to experience immersive.
sentences.chinese: 然而，要领略三清山的美还需身临其境去体验。

sentences.english: It's a six-day immersive experience for the kids.
sentences.chinese: 这六天对儿童来说是一个身临其境的体验。

sentences.english: Immersive online adventure game dealing with a host of biotech issues.
sentences.chinese: 线上冒险游戏身临其境的生物技术处理一系列问题。

sentences.english: Visitors are now standing in a media-rich immersive environment.
sentences.chinese: 游客将处在一个身临其境的媒体环境。

sentences.english: They’ll be coming your way in the not-too-distant future.
sentences.chinese: 在不远的未来你也可以身临其境。

definition: to travel to a place personally (idiom)
the feeling of actually being there
to place oneself/to stay
the feeling that sth is genuine/sense of reality/in the flesh
to experience for oneself
time travel
vivid/distinct/clear/sincere/honest
to sense/perception/to feel (through the senses)/to experience/a feeling/an impression/an experience
to enchant/fascinating
to shake/to shock/to stun/shocking/stunning/shock
(of houses, scenery etc) magnificent (idiom)
to feel as if it had happened to oneself/to sympathize/(polite expression of gratitude for a favor received by a friend etc) I take it as a personal favor
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
to be overwhelmed by emotions
real scene (not set up or posed)/real location (not a film studio set or theater)/live action (not animation)
